title.narrative: OUTPUT 7.4 PM & E

description.narrative: Output 7.4 Planning, and Monitoring and Evaluation, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Special Purpose Outcome

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 7.4 Planning, and Monitoring and Evaluation

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the UN Reform agenda with the finalization of the UNSDCF and aligned Executive Board approval of the 2021 – 2025 GoU – UNICEF Country Programme, in line with the National Development Plan III. UCO achieved quality standards in field monitoring, budget management, donor proposal/report writing, resource mobilization, district systems strengthening and partnerships. Key highlights are the adherence to minimum standards in the monitoring function (despite the stringent lockdown measures). Furthermore, external deadlines for donor reports were 100% met. In the area of partnership management, UNICEF piloted a competitive call for partners in the next Country Programme. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/01/2021
